home.cta_subtitle:
Join thousands of developers who are building faster with Restartly.
Free, open-source, and always will be.

hero.badge: Meet the new standard for Node.js development
hero.subtitle: A high-performance, developer-friendly automatic reload tool. Built for speed, styled for impact, and designed for Node.js & Bun.

features.title: Ultra Capabilities
features.subtitle: Restartly V1.3.2 brings a new level of automation and style to your daily workflow.

universal.title: Universal Support
universal.description: V1.3.2 Native support for Bun and Node.js. Automatically switches runtimes based on your project structure.

cli.title: Interactive CLI
cli.description: Type 'rs' to restart manually or use '--list' to see all available commands and flags instantly.

framework.title: Framework Savvy
framework.description: Intelligent auto-detection for Hono, Next.js, Remix, Astro, and more. It knows how to start your app better than you do.

env.title: Environment Ready
env.description: Built-in .env support via dotenv. Your secrets are automatically injected into your development process.

debounce.title: Smart Debouncing
debounce.description: Intelligently groups rapid-fire file changes to prevent redundant restarts and keep your focus sharp.

runner.title: Reliable Runner
runner.description: Advanced child process management with custom signal handling (SIGTERM/SIGKILL) for a tidy environment.

universal.description: Restartly V1.3.2 is built for the modern web. It intelligently detects your framework and runtime—whether it's Bun, Hono, Next.js, or Remix—and handles the execution so you don't have to.

config.description: Take control of your workflow with <0>restartly.json</0>. Define custom watch paths, ignore complex patterns, and execution commands once.

usage.title: Simple yet powerful
usage.subtitle: Whether you prefer CLI flags or a dedicated <0>restartly.json</0> file, configuring your environment has never been more intuitive.

watch.title: Watch specific directories
watch.description: Monitor only the paths that matter for your current work.

ignore.title: Ignore noisy patterns
ignore.description: Keep your console clean by ignoring logs or temporary files.

zero.title: Zero-Config Mode
zero.description: Just run restartly and let it find your entry point automatically.

cli.title: CLI Reference
cli.quote: "Upgrade to V1.1.0 and feel the difference. From Zero-Config to unified settings, we've got you covered."

footer.rights:
Restartly.
Open source under MIT License.

docs.title: Documentation
docs.subtitle: Everything you need to install, configure, and master Restartly for your development workflow.
docs.note_text: Restartly will automatically detect changes in your current directory and reload the process.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: Restartly is designed to be lightweight and easy to install. You can add it globally to your system or use it as a development dependency in your project.

quick_start.title: Quick Start
quick_start.description: Once installed, you can start watching your application by passing the entry point script to the <0>restartly</0> command.

cli_flags.title: CLI Flags
cli_flags.description: Restartly provides a set of flags to customize its behavior. You can combine multiple flags to suit your development workflow.

watch_paths.title: Watch Paths
watch_paths.description: By default, Restartly watches the current working directory. If you need to watch specific folders, use the <0>--watch</0> flag.

ignore_patterns.title: Ignore Patterns
ignore_patterns.description: To prevent unnecessary reloads, you can ignore certain files or directories. This is useful for temporary files, logs, or coverage reports.

interactive.title: Interactive Commands
interactive.description: Restartly v1.3.0 introduces interactive terminal commands. While Restartly is running, you can interact with it directly from your terminal.
interactive.manual: // Type 'rs' and enter to restart manually
